data.description: Gives insights into your Tail Sampling stats.

widgets.title: Refused Records
widgets.description: Number of records per second failed to consume due to errors

widgets.title: Tail Sampling New Trace Id received
Traces Dropped Too Early
widgets.description: Number of Traces Dropped per second, before policy evaluation due to circular buffer overflow

markdown.markdownText:
# Tail Sampling Circular buffer

A circular buffer is used to ensure the number of traces in-memory doesn't exceed `num_traces`.

When a new trace arrives, the oldest trace is removed. 
This can cause a trace to be dropped before tail sampling policy is evaluated. 

To reduce the chance of this happening, increase `num_traces` or decrease `decision_wait`. Both of those options increase memory usage.

widgets.title: Policy Evaluation Errors
widgets.description: Policy Evaluation errors indicate misconfiguration, Check the logs for more details.

markdown.markdownText:
# Tail Sampling Policy Evaluation
**Policy Evaluation Errors** - indicate misconfigured Tail Sampling policy, check the Collector logs for more information.

**Policy Evaluation latency** measures sampling a batch of traces and passing sampled traces through the remainder of the collector pipeline.

 A latency exceeding **1 second** can delay sampling decisions beyond `decision_wait`, increasing the chance of traces being dropped before sampling.
